description.p: You are a being made of shadows. You gain the following benefits while in dim light or darkness:

ul.li: Your speed increases by 10 feet.
You can use a bonus action to channel and teleport up to 90ft to another dim or dark place that you can see.
While channeling, you are defenseless, triggering attacks of opportunity from nearby enemies. Attacks of opportunity don't cancel the teleportation.

sheet.description: You can use a bonus action to channel and teleport up to 90ft to another dim or dark place that you can see. While channeling, you are defenseless, triggering attacks of opportunity from nearby enemies. Attacks of opportunity don't cancel the teleportation.

element.name: Anti-Component Caster
element.prerequisite: The ability to cast at least one spell.

p.i: Prerequisites: The ability to cast at least one spell.

description.p: Your knowledge of spells allows you to cast spells without specific components, granting you the following benefits:

ul.li: -You can cast spells without material components if there are no components that are consumed by a spell.
-You can cast spells without verbal components.
-You can cast spells without somatic components.
You may forgo 2 of these 3 features for the alternative benefit of:
-Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

sheet.description: You get to choose either 3 benefits, or 1 and an ASI.

description.p: In this case, you get all 3 benefits from the Anti-Component Caster, Variant feat.(no verbal, somatic or non-consumed components needed)

sheet.description: No verbal, somatic, or non-consumed material components needed in your spellcasting.

description.p: In this case, you get one benefit of your choosing, and a +1 to either Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma.

sheet.description: ASI and one of the benefits from the feat (either verbal, somatic or component ignored while spellcasting).

element.name: Cantrip Collector
element.prerequisite: Ability to cast at least 1 spell.

p.i: Prerequisites: Ability to cast at least 1 spell.

description.p: Your time in the presence of wizards has allowed you to learn the following four cantrips: Mage Hand, Mending, Message and Prestidigitation. These spells do not count against your number of spells known.

sheet.description: You gain the Mage Hand, Mending, Message and Prestidigitation cantrips.

description.p: With the power of sheer determination and willpower, you cling onto your life even in the brink of death. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You have advantage on death saving throws.

When you take a damage that reduces your hit point to 0, if you are not killed outright from the damage, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest to use it again.

sheet.description: You get advantage on death saving throws, and once per long rest can drop to 1hp instead of 0 if not killed outright.

description.p: Reflect attacks aimed at you back at your enemy, but with double the power.

ul.li: When selecting this feat, pick either magical or physical attacks. Upon being hit by either a magical or melee attack, you can use your reaction to reflect double the damage onto the attacker. You regain the use of this ability after a long rest.

sheet.description: You can return either a magical or physical attack, at double the power, back at your enemy once per long rest.

element.name: Interposing Reaction
element.prerequisite: Constitution 13 or higher, Dexterity 13 or higher.

p.i: Prerequisites: Constitution 13 or higher, Dexterity 13 or higher.

description.p: You have gained the reaction time to save your friends from danger, no matter what happens to you:

ul.li: You increase your Constitution by 1 point, to a maximum of 20.

When you see an ally within your range of movement being attacked, you can choose to take their place for the blow, knocking the ally prone in a square adjacent to you and free of harm. This attack hits you no matter your AC, and you take damage as if it had. This includes spell attacks, melee attacks, and ranged attacks.

sheet.description: You can choose to take an ally's place when you see them get hit by a spell, melee or range attack. You knock your ally prone into a safe place, and take the whole blow, no matter your AC, it hits.

description.p: After sensing your fiendish lineage pulse with dark power years ago, you've been training in the magic of lust. By touching someone with a tiny bit of your saliva, sweat or cum, you can use an action to attempt to seduce them, increasing their libido and deeply charming them for a duration of your concentration (max 1 hour).

ul.li: The creature must have an intelligence of 5 or more, and must make a wisdom saving throw against your spell DC (8 + prof + cha mod).
If the creature saves, the creature becomes immune to this charm for the next 24 hours.
If the creature fails, they become charmed and are deeply seduced for an hour; if the target receives damage directed from someone outside the party and allies, the target gets to save again.
Also, if the caster does something bad or trully harmful to them (safe BDSM doesn't count), or the caster loses concentration or becomes unconscious, then the spell instantly ends.

The caster can end the spell as a bonus action. Only one creature can be affected by the charm at a time, and if the spell is cast or affects another creature, the first creature will stop being affected.
When the spell ends, the affected creature realizes magic was used on them, but if treated well during the spell, they might not be hostile or even angry about it.

description.p: While concentrating on the spell, the effect on a creature can be reinforced without ending it. To do so, you must reapply the saliva and use another use of this feature, and the target must make a wisdom saving throw with disadvantage against your spell dc. If they fail, the charm's time (an hour) is reset. If they succeed, the spell ends, wasting that use. You can use this feature an amount of times equal to your CHAmod per short or long rest.

sheet.description: You gain the ability to deeply seduce a creature.

element.name: Magic Initiate, Variant
element.prerequisite: At least 8 levels in a single spellcasting class.

p.i: Prerequisites: Ability to cast at least 1 spell and play at least 1 instrument

description.p: Choose a spellcasting class: bard, cleric, druid, sorcerer, warlock, wizard

ul.li: You learn two cantrips of your choice from that class spell list and may add the appropriate spellcasting ability modifier to the damage of these two cantrips.

In addition, you learn the spell Find Familiar and, using this feat, can cast it at its lowest level to call a Pseudodragon. Once you cast it in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells depends on the class you chose: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.

sheet.description: You learn two cantrips from a spellcasting class of your choosing, may add the respective modifiers to their damage, and can cast Find Familiar once per long rest using this feat to call a Pseudodragon.

description.p: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the bard's spell list.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is charisma.

sheet.description: Spellcasting ability: Charisma.

description.p: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the cleric's spell list.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is wisdom.

sheet.description: Spellcasting ability: Wisdom.

description.p: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the druid spell list.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is wisdom.

sheet.description: Spellcasting ability: Wisdom.

description.p: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the sorcerer's spell list.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is charisma.

sheet.description: Spellcasting ability: Charisma.

description.p: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the warlock's spell list.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is charisma.

sheet.description: Spellcasting ability: Charisma.

description.p: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the wizard's spell list.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells is intelligence.

sheet.description: Spellcasting ability: Intelligence.

element.name: Silent Performance
element.prerequisite: Ability to cast at least 1 spell and play at least 1 instrument

p.i: Prerequisites: Ability to cast at least 1 spell and play at least 1 instrument

description.p: As a magical caster and performer you've spent several hours practicing your craft to be as unique and useful as possible. This allows you to gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in Performance. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

When casting a spell with a verbal component you may make a Performance check against viewers' passive (Perception). If you are successful they are unaware of a spell being cast and believe it is just a performance. If you succeed by 5 or more you can choose to have the performance be silent.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency or expertise in Performance, can perform, replacing the verbal component of a spell, and can make it silent for other creatures.

element.name: Snap Shooter
element.prerequisite: Dexterity or Strength of 13 or higher.

description.p: While wielding a ranged weapon with which you are proficient, you threaten squares within 5 feet of you. You can make attacks of opportunity with that ranged weapon. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity when making a ranged attack as an attack of opportunity. Additionally, the area of space you threaten with opportunity attacks increases with your ability score as follows:

ul.li: 13 - You threaten an area of 5 ft.
15 - You threaten an area of 10 ft.
17 or higher - You threaten an area of 15 ft.

sheet.description: Your AoO reactions can be ranged, and you threaten an area that increases with your Dexterity or Strenght score.

element.name: Thrifty Caster
element.prerequisite: Ability to cast at least 1 spell.

description.p: Your knowledge of spells allows you to cast spells without materials, granting you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You can cast spells without material components if the combined cost of the materials is less than 250 gp.

sheet.description: Ignore material components if the combined cost is less than 250gp.

element.name: Trained Blindsight
element.prerequisite: Being completely blind and having trained your other senses for years.

description.p: After being born blind or losing you sight as a child or many years ago, you tried to better your other senses to superhuman levels. Or maybe you have something special that allows you to detect without sight, such as a bats echolocation. You can change how the blindsight exactly works with your DM, depending on what you want it to be.
When you choose this feat, you gain the following traits:

ul.li: You lose all normal / natural sight, and you gain Blindsight with a radius of 30ft. You cannot see anything past this radius unless you use special or magical means to do so, but can hear or smell like normal.
You automatically fail all checks that rely entirely on sight, and have disadvantage on any checks that rely mostly on sight.
You have disadvantage on any saving throw against sudden loud sounds or powerful smells, such as the sound created by the Thunderwave spell.
You are immune to conditions or effects that require sight, such the blind condition, gaze effects, invisibility or darkness of any kind. You are also vulnerable to Thunder damage.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell, hearing or touch.

Once on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to focus your senses. If you succeed, your Blindsight radius increases to 60ft until the start of your following turn. You can do this a number of times equal to Wisdom modifier, and recharges on a long rest.

sheet.description: Through training, you gained blindsight.

description.p: Your charm or quirkiness has called a curious spirit, which is now bonded to you, granting you the following benefits:

ul.li: You learn the Find Familiar spell, which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again.
When choosing your familiarâ€™s form, you can choose any beast or monstrosity up to CR 1/4.
While you are touching your familiar, you can change its form as an action, without needing to cast the spell.

While touching your familiar, you can also change it's type, as an action, from another type on the list, without needing to cast the spell. The list of types is also expanded to the following: aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, undead.

sheet.description: Your charm or quirkiness has called a curious spirit, which is now bonded to you. You can cast the Find Familiar spell once per long rest for free, to summon a beast or monstrosity up to CR 1/4. It's form and type can be changed as an action while touching the familiar.

description.p: You can use your vampiric reflexes to dodge attacks and move with an unearthly grace and ease, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: You have advantage against effects that would knock you prone, push you, or otherwise physically move you. Doesn't apply to teleportation or other similar effects.
While you are wearing no armor, your Armor Class equals 12 + your Dexterity modifier.
Your base movement speed increases by 10 feet.

description.p: If you are wearing the Ring of Dracula, you also gain the following benefits from this feat:
If your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution scores are less then 18, they become 18.

sheet.description: You can use your vampiric reflexes to dodge attacks and move with an unearthly grace and ease, gaining certain benefits.

description.p: Vampires are known for their ability to shift from form to form. You gain the shapechanger tag and if you are not in sunlight or running water, you can use your action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist for 1 minute, or back into your true form.

ul.li: Bat Form: While in bat form you can't speak, your walking speed is 5 feet, and you have a flying speed of 30 feet. Your statistics, other than your size and speed, are unchanged. Anything you are wearing transforms with you, but nothing you are carrying does. You revert to your true form if you die.

Mist Form: While in mist form, you can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. You are weightless and have a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. You have advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, gain a number of temporary hit points equal to twice your level, and are immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage you take from sunlight.

description.p: Once you transform this way you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.
If you are wearing the Ring of Dracula, you also gain the following benefits from this feat:
You can maintain your other forms indefinetely, and gain the Humanoid Form:

ul.li: Humanoid Form: You can use your action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid you have seen, or back into your true form. Your statistics, other than your size, are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed and you revert to your true form if you die. While in this form you can use your Bite and Claws attacks.

sheet.description: Vampires are known for their ability to shift from form to form. You gain the shapechanger tag and can transform into a tiny bat or a medium mist cloud.

description.p: You can suffuse your unholy lifeforce into creatures you drain. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you can choose to animate it, causing it to rise at the next midnight as a zombie under your control. This zombie can take simple commands from you and you may have a number of zombies equal to your proficiency bonus under your control through this method at a time.
If you already have your maximum number of zombies under your control other corpses which rise due to your bite are not under your control are hostile towards you and others.
At 18th level, your bite may raise vampire spawns instead of zombies. You may have up to one vampire spawn under your control through this method at any time.
If you are wearing the Ring of Dracula, you also gain the following benefits from this feat:
You may have a number of zombies under your control equal to double your proficiency bonus, and up to 2 vampire spawns.

sheet.description: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you can choose to animate it, causing it to rise at the next midnight as a zombie or vampire spawn under your control.

description.p: As an action, you may magically call 2d4 swarms of bats or rats, provided the sun isn't up. While outdoors, you can call 2d6 wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as your allies and obeying your spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, and can be dismissed as a bonus action. You may not call on more than one swarm at any time, and you may not summon creatures with this feat more than once every hour.
If you are wearing the Ring of Dracula, you also gain the following benefits from this feat:

The amount of swarms of bats or rats you can summon becomes 4d4, and the amount of wolves you can summon becomes 3d6. You can instead choose to summon 1d4 swarms of cranium rats, or 2d4 dire wolves. The creatures instead arrive at the start of your next turn, and you have no time limit on when you can summon creatures with the feat.

sheet.description: As an action, you may magically call swarms of bats or rats, or a pack of wolves.

description.p: As an action, you can target one humanoid you can see within 30 feet. If the target can see you, it must succeed a Wisdom saving throw, or be charmed. The DC for the save is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. The charmed target regards you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under your direct control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for your Vampiric Bite/Draining Fangs.

Each time you or one of your companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts for 24 hours, until you are destroyed, until you on a different plane of existence than the target, or if you take a bonus action to end the effect. You can only have one creature charmed this way at once and you can use this trait a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier before you must complete a long rest before using it again.
If you are wearing the Ring of Dracula, you also gain the following benefits from this feat:

Instead of only one creature, you can have a number of creatures charmed this way equal to your Charisma modifier. They also have disadvantage on the saving throw, and creatures charmed this way have no recollection of their time while charmed. You can use this a number of times equal to twice your Charisma modifier.

sheet.description: As an action, you can target one humanoid you can see within 30 feet. If the target can see you, it must succeed a Wisdom saving throw, or be charmed for the next 24 hours or until you drop the charm, go to another plane, are destroyed or they save.
